      Classes in com.sri.ai.grinder.interpreter that implement BinaryFunction 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractInterpreter
      A Rewriter based on a TopRewriter, adding the functionality of solving quantified and aggregate expressions with a MultiQuantifierEliminator provided by the implementation of an abstract method.
      class  BruteForceCommonInterpreter
      An extension of BruteForceInterpreter using CommonSimplifier.
      class  BruteForceInterpreter
      An implementation of AbstractInterpreter using BruteForceMultiQuantifierEliminator.
      class  SamplingCommonInterpreter
      An extension of SamplingInterpreter using CommonSimplifier.
      class  SamplingInterpreter
      This interpreter will evaluate expressions, but will sample quantifiers instead of using brute force.
      class  TopRewriterUsingContextAssignments
      A TopRewriter based on another TopRewriter, and adding functionality for replacing expressions by their assignments stored on the context, stored there by AbstractIterativeMultiIndexQuantifierEliminator#extendAssignments(Map newAssignments, Context context).
      class  TopRewriterUsingContextAssignmentsReceivingBaseTopRewriterAtConstruction
      A convenience variant of TopRewriterUsingContextAssignments that takes its base top rewriter at construction time.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Expression CommutativeAssociativeOnNumbers.dealWithInfinity(Expression expression, Context context, BinaryFunction<Expression,Context,Expression> fallback)
      If arguments of expression contain Expressions.INFINITY but not Expressions.MINUS_INFINITY, returns INFINITY; if they contain Expressions.MINUS_INFINITY but not Expressions.INFINITY, returns MINUS_INFINITY; if they contain both, throw an error if tye contain none, returns the result provided by provided fallback function

      class  CommonSimplifier
      A TopRewriter aggregating: BindingTopSimplifier: replaces symbols by their values(=, !=) BooleanSimplifier: boolean connectives (and, or, not, <=>, =>) and if then else NumericSimplifier: arithmetic (+, -, *, /) and inequalities (<, <=, >=, >) EqualitySimplifier: equality and disequality (=, !=) InequalitySimplifier: inequality (<, <=, >, >=) CardinalityOfSetConstantSimplifier: cardinalities (must be registered in context's global objects as a function application of | .
      class  CommonSimplifiersAndSymbolicQuantifierEliminationRewritersTopRewriter
      A TopRewriter aggregating: CommonSimplifier SymbolicQuantifierEliminatorRewritersTopRewriter.
      class  SymbolicQuantifierEliminatorRewritersTopRewriter
      A TopRewriter aggregating symbolic quantifier eliminators for +, *, max, cardinality, for all and there exists using DefaultMultiQuantifierEliminator (SGVET for summations).

    • Uses of BinaryFunction in com.sri.ai.grinder.rewriter.api

      Subinterfaces of BinaryFunction in com.sri.ai.grinder.rewriter.api 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Rewriter
      A rewriter can be seen as a "step solver applier" to a given expression under a given context.
      interface  RewriterFromStepMaker
      A utility functional interface to make Rewriters out of functions from (Expression, Context) to Steps.
      interface  Simplifier
      A Simplifier knows just enough about the symbols in a language to simplify it in a shallow way, that is, to replace function applications by a simpler equivalent expression, if that expression is determined by their immediate arguments.
      interface  TopRewriter
      An indicator interface for rewriters that are either a Switch rewriter, or a CombiningTopRewriter (an extension of FirstOf) rewriter with base top rewriters, or a basic rewriter that typically will not recurse.

    • Uses of BinaryFunction in com.sri.ai.grinder.rewriter.core

      Classes in com.sri.ai.grinder.rewriter.core that implement BinaryFunction 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CombiningTopRewriter
      An extension of FirstOf that consolidates a list of TopRewriters that are either switches or first of top rewriters, by merging Switch rewriters based on the same key maker, and flattening TopRewriters of switches.
      class  Exhaustive
      Applies a base rewriter exhaustively.
      class  FirstOf
      Applies a list of base rewriters until one of them modifies the original expression, returning this as the overall result.
      class  IfEquals<T>
      A Switch extension that compares a key maker's result to a predefined value and executes a given base rewriter if they are equal and returns the same expression otherwise.
      class  IfRewriter
      A TopRewriter that executes one of two base top rewriters based on a predicate.
      class  Recursive
      Applies a base rewriter on an expression and then recursively on sub-expressions.
      class  Switch<T>
      A rewriter that stores a map from keys in some type to base Rewriters and a key maker function to Expressions to the key type.

    • Uses of BinaryFunction in com.sri.ai.grinder.rewriter.help

      Classes in com.sri.ai.grinder.rewriter.help that implement BinaryFunction 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CompleteRewriter
      A Rewriter that takes a base TopRewriter and applies it recursively, exhaustively, and with literal externalization.
      class  LiteralRewriter
      A rewriter that replaces literals by their values according to the context or, if not defined by the context, splits on them (after a simplification according to a given simplifier).
      class  RedirectingRewriter
      A rewriter that redirects its calls to another, base rewriter.
      class  RedirectingTopRewriter
      Analogous to RedirectingRewriter, but for a TopRewriter.

      Accumulates the values for each key using an accumulator function, returning an empty map if no maps are provided, the first map (the instance itself) if it is equal to the result, or a new map with the accumulated values otherwise.

      Accumulates the values for each key using an accumulator function, returning an empty map if no maps are provided, the first map (the instance itself) if it is equal to the result, or a new map with the accumulated values otherwise.
